# Draft:Joel Edwards (British singer)

Joel Edwards is a British singer, songwriter, producer and remixer, best known as the vocalist and co-writer of the electronic music duo Deepest Blue with producer Matt Schwartz. Their 2003 debut single, "Deepest Blue", reached number 7 on the UK Singles Chart.
Early career
Edwards began his career in the early 2000s working with UK garage producer Ed Case, co-writing material for the album ''Ed's Guest List (2002). The album featured collaborations with artists including Ming Xia of Spooks, Saffron of Republica, and Shaun Escoffery, who later starred as Mufasa in the The Lion King'' in London’s West End.
Deepest Blue
In 2003, Edwards co-founded the electronic music act Deepest Blue with producer Matt Schwartz. Their debut single, "Deepest Blue", peaked at number 7 on the UK Singles Chart. The follow-up singles "Give It Away" and "Is It a Sin?" reached numbers 9 and 24 respectively on the UK chart.
The track "Shooting Star" was later used as the theme music for Sky Sports football coverage and charted at number 57 in the UK.
The group's debut album, Late September (2004), reached number 22 on the UK Albums Chart. The album artwork was created by graphic designer Storm Thorgerson, best known for his work with Pink Floyd. Parts of the album were recorded aboard David Gilmour’s houseboat studio, The Astoria.
In 2024, Deepest Blue began a new series of remixes of their classic material, with versions by Goom Gum, Fred V, and Ferry Corsten released on Armada Music.
Solo career
In 2008, Edwards signed a solo recording deal with Mercury Records and recorded the album Lost and Found at Studio 2 of Olympic Studios in London, using the original EMI mixing desk formerly used by The Beatles.
The sessions were engineered by Andy Bradfield, known for his work with David Bowie, Elton John, Everything But The Girl, and George Michael, and mixed by Tom Elmhirst, who has worked with Adele, Amy Winehouse, and David Bowie. The album was mastered by the late John Davis at Metropolis Studios, whose mastering credits include work for Led Zeppelin, U2, The Killers, and Gorillaz.
The album featured a full orchestra arranged and conducted by Simon Hale, with contributions from Georgie Fame (Hammond organ), Ralph Salmins (drums), Steve Pearce (bass), Simon Carter (keyboards), and Ian Barter (guitar), known for his work with Amy Winehouse. The album was co-produced by Robin Barter alongside Edwards.
Originally shelved following internal restructuring at Mercury, Lost and Found was officially released on Mercury Records / Universal Music Group in 2025.
Other musical projects
Edwards has released music under several aliases, including TrAmHeD, London Fields, DEE-LUX, and Dead Guys. From 2009 to 2010, he served as the live frontman for Planet Funk, standing in for Dan Black during the band's European shows.
He also co-wrote and produced the track "This Time" for Melanie C, best known as "Sporty Spice" of the Spice Girls.
He has also provided featured and guest vocals on numerous recordings by other artists, including releases with Danny Howard, Kryder, Chicane, and Dave Lee.
Remix and production work
As a remixer and producer, Edwards has worked with or remixed artists including:
* Pixie Lott – "Turn It Up"
* Blondie – "Good Boys"
* Lamb – "Wonder"
* Chicane – "Locking Down"
* Texas – "Can't Resist"
* Sway – "Party Like Ur 18"
His work has been remixed by producers including:
* Eric Prydz
* Ferry Corsten
* Goom Gum
* Fred V
* DJEFF
* Jon Hopkins
In 2021, Russian duo Filatov & Karas released "Give It Away x Deepest Blue", which was certified Platinum in Poland by ZPAV.
Advertising work
In addition to his recording career, Edwards has composed and produced music for international advertising campaigns, including work for Samsung, Ford, and Littlewoods.
Labels and affiliations
Edwards has released music through the following labels:
* Ministry of Sound
* Armada Music
* Mercury Records
* Universal Music Group
* Sony Music
* Warner Music Group
* Z Records (founded by Dave Lee)
* Toolroom Records
